Detailed Description

Utility Functions.

Author:
Carlos Eduardo Mello
Date:
3/5/2009
MuM utilities includes functions which are used by MuM classes to perform routine tasks such as initializing arrays ( Set() ), picking random values within a range ( Between() ), etc.

Definition in file MuUtil.h.

Function Documentation

float Between ( float  min,
float  max 
)

Random float between low and high.

This function returns a randomly picked float value within given limits (obs.: upper and lower limits are included in range)

Parameters:
min lower limit
max upper limit

short Inside ( short  value,
short *  array,
short  n 
)

Searches short value in array.

This function tries to find a short inside an array of shorts. If value is found, it returns its index in the array; otherwise it returns -1

Parameters:
value search key value
array buffer to be searched
n number of elements in array

void MuInit ( void   ) 

Various initializations needed by the framework.

This function needs to be called in a program before using any methods in the MuM framework, so that subsequent calls work properly.

Definition at line 26 of file MuUtil.cpp.

void Set ( int *  array,
int  n,
int  value 
)

Sets array of 'n' ints to 'value'.

This function sets 'n' elements of 'array' to 'value'; but if n == 0, 'value' is treated as the array size, and elements are incremented from 0. (i.e.: 0, 1, 2, 3,...)

Parameters:
array address of int buffer to be set
n number of elements in array (0 flags increment mode)
value value to set array to (if n == 0, number of elements)

)

Sorts an array of ints.

This function sorts every element of 'array' in ascending order
